alert.note: Alert for Doddridge; Harrison; Tyler (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 1:51PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Doddridge, east central Tyler and northwestern Harrison Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 151 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Jacksonburg, or 13 miles southeast of Middlebourne, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Center Point, Sedalia, and Lima. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for northern West Virginia.
